meanings.definition: Able to read but choosing not to do so.
meanings.sent1: She is aliterate, preferring to listen to audiobooks instead of reading.
meanings.sent2: Some people are aliterate because they find reading boring.
meanings.sent3: The aliterate student joked that books were just dust collectors.
meanings.sent4: His aliterate behavior towards books was like a closed door to knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The aliterate attitude towards reading was evident in her bookshelf filled with untouched novels.

meanings.definition: A person who is capable of reading but chooses not to.
meanings.sent1: The aliterate in the group always brought a magazine to read during book club meetings.
meanings.sent2: Being an aliterate doesn't mean you can't enjoy storytelling in other forms.
meanings.sent3: The aliterate at the library spent more time browsing DVDs than books.
meanings.sent4: She felt like an aliterate fish in a sea of bookworms at the literature event.
meanings.sent5: The aliterate's bookshelf was filled with untouched novels, gathering dust over time.
